meanings.definition: The central or most important feature.
meanings.sent1: The birthday cake was the centrepiece of the party.
meanings.sent2: The flagpole stood as the centrepiece of the town square.
meanings.sent3: The giant inflatable duck became the centrepiece of the pool party.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was the centrepiece of the gathering.
meanings.sent5: The glowing fireplace served as the cozy centrepiece of the living room.

meanings.definition: An object placed in the center of a table as a decoration.
meanings.sent1: The floral arrangement served as the centrepiece for the dining table.
meanings.sent2: The elegant candle holder was the centrepiece of the fancy dinner.
meanings.sent3: The quirky gnome statue became the centrepiece of conversation at the family dinner.
meanings.sent4: The shimmering crystal bowl acted as the centrepiece, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fruit basket stood out as the vibrant centrepiece on the table.
